body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage
For detailed information about the code coverage, see the [test coverage report](https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/28852).
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [Sjors](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28852#issuecomment-1809561795), [ryanofsky](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28852#pullrequestreview-1763521007) |
| Concept ACK | [BrandonOdiwuor](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28852#pullrequestreview-1740123770) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ð to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
On macOS 13.6 this silently exits with `-1` when a node is _not_ pruned (`pruneheight` is not set).
diff_hunk:
@@ -26,6 +28,57 @@ OUTPUT_PATH="${1}"; shift;
 # Most of the calls we make take a while to run, so pad with a lengthy timeout.
 BITCOIN_CLI_CALL="${*} -rpcclienttimeout=9999999"
 
+# Check if the node is pruned and get the pruned block height
+PRUNED=$( ${BITCOIN_CLI_CALL} getblockchaininfo | grep 'pruneheight' | awk '{print $2}' | tr -d ',' )

body: If I abort here with `ctrl + c` it tries to cleanup, so maybe move the `trap` calls down a bit?
diff_hunk:
@@ -26,6 +28,57 @@ OUTPUT_PATH="${1}"; shift;
 # Most of the calls we make take a while to run, so pad with a lengthy timeout.
 BITCOIN_CLI_CALL="${*} -rpcclienttimeout=9999999"
 
+# Check if the node is pruned and get the pruned block height
+PRUNED=$( ${BITCOIN_CLI_CALL} getblockchaininfo | grep 'pruneheight' | awk '{print $2}' | tr -d ',' )
+
+if (( GENERATE_AT_HEIGHT < PRUNED )); then
+  echo "Error: The requested snapshot height (${GENERATE_AT_HEIGHT}) should be greater than the pruned block height (${PRUNED})."
+  exit 1
+fi
+
+# Early exit if file at OUTPUT_PATH already exists
+if [[ -e "$OUTPUT_PATH" ]]; then
+  (>&2 echo "Error: $OUTPUT_PATH already exists or is not a valid path.")
+  exit 1
+fi
+
+# Validate that the path is correct
+if [[ "${OUTPUT_PATH}" != "-" && ! -d "$(dirname "${OUTPUT_PATH}")" ]]; then
+  (>&2 echo "Error: The directory $(dirname "${OUTPUT_PATH}") does not exist.")
+  exit 1
+fi
+
+function cleanup {
+  (>&2 echo "Restoring chain to original height; this may take a while")
+  ${BITCOIN_CLI_CALL} reconsiderblock "${PIVOT_BLOCKHASH}"
+
+  if $NETWORK_DISABLED; then
+    (>&2 echo "Restoring network activity")
+    ${BITCOIN_CLI_CALL} setnetworkactive true
+  fi
+}
+
+function early_exit {
+  (>&2 echo "Exiting due to Ctrl-C")
+  cleanup
+  exit 1
+}
+
+# Trap for normal exit and Ctrl-C
+trap cleanup EXIT
+trap early_exit INT
+
+# Prompt the user to disable network activity
+read -p "Do you want to disable network activity (setnetworkactive false) before running invalidateblock? (Y/n): " -r

body: Note that once `invalidateblock` has been called, this won't stop it. It will go all the way back and then forward again.
diff_hunk:
@@ -26,6 +28,57 @@ OUTPUT_PATH="${1}"; shift;
 # Most of the calls we make take a while to run, so pad with a lengthy timeout.

+fi
+

+  (>&2 echo "Error: The directory $(dirname "${OUTPUT_PATH}") does not exist.")
+  exit 1
+fi
+
+function cleanup {
+  (>&2 echo "Restoring chain to original height; this may take a while")
+  ${BITCOIN_CLI_CALL} reconsiderblock "${PIVOT_BLOCKHASH}"

body: By the way, at some point when a bash script gets very complicated, it may be better to convert it to Python.
I'll update it with an alternative, as I don't have an instance with macOS, please let me know if that would work better now.
diff_hunk:
@@ -26,6 +28,57 @@ OUTPUT_PATH="${1}"; shift;
 # Most of the calls we make take a while to run, so pad with a lengthy timeout.
 BITCOIN_CLI_CALL="${*} -rpcclienttimeout=9999999"
 
+# Check if the node is pruned and get the pruned block height
+PRUNED=$( ${BITCOIN_CLI_CALL} getblockchaininfo | grep 'pruneheight' | awk '{print $2}' | tr -d ',' )

body: Yes! I'll do, but the `reconsiderblock` won't do anything, the issue I see now is that `PIVOT_BLOCKHASH` wasn't initialised so perhaps it fails there.
diff_hunk:
@@ -26,6 +28,57 @@ OUTPUT_PATH="${1}"; shift;
 # Most of the calls we make take a while to run, so pad with a lengthy timeout.

+fi

+function cleanup {

+  fi
+}
+

+  (>&2 echo "Exiting due to Ctrl-C")
+  cleanup
+  exit 1
+}
+
+# Trap for normal exit and Ctrl-C
+trap cleanup EXIT
+trap early_exit INT

+# Prompt the user to disable network activity
+read -p "Do you want to disable network activity (setnetworkactive false) before running invalidateblock? (Y/n): " -r

body:
Same as in the previous PR #27845. We could add more context in the output message and perhaps we could update the documentation as well:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/5800c558eb5efb4839ed00d6967e43306d68e1c3/doc/design/assumeutxo.md?plain=1#L42-L45

body:
> By the way, at some point when a bash script gets very complicated, it may be better to convert it to Python.

I do agree, but so far I think it's manageable. I'm happy to convert it if more reviewers see other issues there.

body:
Addressed @Sjors's feedback.

cc @jamesob as he reviewed #27845, @ryanofsky & @theStack

In commit "script: Enhance validations in utxo_snapshot.sh" (11b7269d83a56f919f9dddb7f7c72a96d428627f)

Assignment seems a little out of place here, would suggest moving it below `PRUNE=...` with other variable assignments.
diff_hunk:
@@ -1,13 +1,15 @@
 #!/usr/bin/env bash
 #
-# Copyright (c) 2019 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Copyright (c) 2019-2023 The Bitcoin Core developers
 # Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
 # file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
 #
 export LC_ALL=C
 
 set -ueo pipefail
 
+NETWORK_DISABLED=false

body: Note: this actually had 3 acks. DrahtBot didn't count https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28852#pullrequestreview-1741060818 due to capitalization
